definition: to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against

sentences.english: In cricket, a no ball reckons as one run.
sentences.chinese: 在板球中，投球违例要失一分。

sentences.english: Of course, not all traffic offences are covered by this system.
sentences.chinese: 当然，并非所有交通违例事件包括在此制度。

sentences.english: A player grasps the basket to play the ball. This is valid also after the ball has touched the ring.
sentences.chinese: 一名球员抓住球篮而对球作操弄，就是干扰球违例。

sentences.english: During full court scrimmages make it a violation when a player dribbles .
sentences.chinese: 打全场练习赛时有人运球就算违例。

sentences.english: The referee whistles a technical fault for the digging player.
sentences.chinese: 运动员在防守过程中由于违例而被裁判吹哨。

sentences.english: There's the white, it's a violation.
sentences.chinese: 这就是白色，它是一个违例。

sentences.english: The referee whistles a technical fault for the serving player.
sentences.chinese: 发球运动员由于违例而被裁判鸣哨。

sentences.english: The receiving player commits a technical fault penalized by the referee.
sentences.chinese: 接发球运动员违例而被裁判鸣哨。

sentences.english: Offenders could be fined up to $50，000 or get four years' jail.
sentences.chinese: 违例者可被判罚款五万元或入狱四年。

definition: to scout for a tour operator/to reconnoiter a potential tour itinerary/(tennis) to commit a foot fault
to cross a border/to go out of bounds (sport)
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
to serve the ball/to tee off
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
